Fields.Title: Prologue Start
Fields.Dialogue Text: I remember when I was a child...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: maybe 5 years old...
Spring had arrived. The air felt fresh. I could hear a stream rushing over the rocks by the river.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: We went on a trip by car to the mountains with my family, dad, mum and my two sisters.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Can you reminisce memories from when you were only five?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I donÂ´t remember everything. Only the most vivid moments...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: So we arrived and set up the tents. The landscape, with those frosty mountains, was breathtaking.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I had such a strong feeling that everything around was pulsing and alive...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Myriads of flowers of different varieties and colors painted a beautiful rendition, worthy of the most skilled and sensible painter.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: A moment ago you felt so extatic. Now, for some reason, I feel you became sad.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Come on, don't be sad now. Don't ruin the story!

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Well, you know. A kid is born innocent. A blank canvas. He still doesn't know about what the adult life means yet...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: We all have sad memories somewhere. Though life is a beautiful gift to only remember the bad things. Don't you think?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I guess you a right... it's just that... it seems I can get it out of my mind.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Don't worry. I'm here to help you. To listen to you for as long as you need.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: That's so kind of you.. I appreciate it.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: It's fine, don't worry. Let's move forward. Where I was? Ah, yes... so I was in that flowery field with my father...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: You are right. I always ruin the best stories...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Yes, you do. Too often.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Your words do not help me. Do you want me to continue with the story?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: So I asked him...
There are many flowers dad...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I don't want to tread on them...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: ... and kill them.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: My father looked at me, bemused...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: and told me...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Jump.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: You just need to jump over them.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: This way, you won't kill the flowers you'll encounter...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: A feeling of happiness and relief overcame me...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: So as we moved down the valley...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I run like crazy, smiling and jumping over as many flowers as I could...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: But then...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I saw him at the distance,, as I had been running downhill for a few minutes...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: But I could clearly see...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: that he would never jump over any flower as he told me to do.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Why my father didn't care about those beautiful little beings....

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: is something that I would discover a few years later, when I was 7...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: After we settled as I said, my father took me on a walk while my mum and sisters stayed at the tent...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Did anyone in your family took pictures of that trip?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: My father had a polaroid cam. So there must be some photos stored somewhere inside an old sneakers box.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: So continuing with the story...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: God seems to strive for good... but we humans...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Feel free to continue with your story. Or if you need a pause, we can take a break.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: The same old story again?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: If you don't like it. You can leave know.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I was joking. Come on, continue with your story.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Oh yes, I'll do.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Fine. I don't come back again. I'm done with you.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: You never knew how to listen others. It's only about "you"... But who are "you" anyways? Who do you think you are to look others over your shoulder?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I wish that the flowers that cross my path live.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Just jump.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I turned back...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: ... to look where my father was.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I don't want to tread this bad dream alone...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Is the sedation ready?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Not yet, The doctor is coming soon. Please continue. Go as far as you can. I'm here with you.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I'll try...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: today I seem to recall almost everything quite vividly...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Some days are better than others... If last week I could only see blurred images...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: That's a good thing. Let's move on...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Where I was? So after that trip, we went back home. The next day I had to go to school.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Just after school, most of the kids of my age would run fast to our homes...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Things could get pretty intense. Imagine a dozen kids chasing the same ball.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Our mothers would give as a chocolate bar and a piece of bread as we opened the door...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: and after throwing our school backpacks on our bedroom, we would run back downstairs to the street again...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: After exchanging bites to test our friends' brunch, we were ready to play football...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: We used some garage doors as goals, but the neighborghs weren't that happy about the idea...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: If the doors we chose were metallic, we made a lot of noise every time we scored...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: ...top that with our screaming when we chased the ball like crazy and asked our friends to pass it...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: But in the end, our grandmas and aunts were happy to see us play in that narrow street where everyone seemed to live so happily...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: And indeed, those were one of the happiest moments in my life as a kid...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: But then, my mother would call me to go upstairs for dinner....

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: And then, as I walked up the stairs, my kid's view of the world would gradually become blurred...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: and that happiness that I had felt while playing with my friends would soon vanish....

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: When dawn gave way to the black pitch darkness of the night,  tiny particles of that fear would start filling up my chest...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: A primal fear.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Is not the sedation ready yet?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: It's coming In a few minutes

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I don't want to continue. I'm tired. Come back tomorrow, please.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Can you just tell me what happened the next hour after you went home?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: No... I'm tired.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Have a bit of patience. The doctor is coming.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I can't go on. I can't get past those dark memories alone.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: The doctor is here. She brought the sedative for you.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Fear.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: ThatÂ´s what I felt. Even I didnÂ´t know itÂ´s name yet being a kid.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I feel my breath running short.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I canÂ´t.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: The same fear again.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I have tried many times already.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Will you help me?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Yes, I want to help you. We'll move on this time, believe me.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: ThatÂ´s a relief,. IÂ´m ready for the shot, doc. Here my arm.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I start feeling drowsy...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Doc, after the shot please connect the brain nodes to both of us.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: ItÂ´s time for a deep dive.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I hope we donÂ´t lose another patient again.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: This fucking biotech lab. Are we their guinea pigs or what?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: The patient is sound asleep.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Remember, though your shot is more diluted. There can be collateral effects if your heart rate pumps up too much.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Yeah I know, thatÂ´s what they teach us in the academy. I'll keep my cool.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Okey, itÂ´s time for me I guess. Secure me the chair please.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Last patient died in quite horrible convulsions and I end up with a few bruises.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Time to enter our patients mind. God concede me the grace to save this one.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: All yours doc, do your thing.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: DonÂ´t worry. The techs secured the chairs after a few of these unfortunate events last week.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Good luck with this one. The med history of the patient is a bit... messed up.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Shot applied. Before falling asleep, remember...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: The nightmare is not real. ItÂ´s just memories...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: DonÂ´t make it yours. If you want to help him, maintain the separation at all times.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Yeah, I know doc.... I start feeling the effects...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: See...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Mum... what did you do for dinner?
